page.title: 10Colvend: Farming (cont'd)
page.content: When a cow has calved she gives milk for ten months. Suckling cows feed the calves for about seven months. The bull calves are then put out to rough grazing until they are fourteen months old and fattened for the butcher. The farmers keep two bulls to mate with the cows. A Friesian heifer's first calf is usually a Hereford since they are small and grow quickly. The dairyman uses electric milking machines to suck out the milk twice a day. The milk is piped into a tank to cool it, until the milk tanker comes and takes it away to the creamery. Each farm employs only three or four men.They all have tractors and fix other machines to the back to do the work. In summer they may employ extra workers to cut silage or hay.
